page.title: 07Evesham High School
page.content: This is a comprehesive school for children from 13 upwards who have previously attended Blackminster Middle School and Simon De Montfort Middle School. The school which opened in 1954 is set in 18 acres of grounds. The buildings include a design block, 8 science laboratories, a reprographics centre, a 6th form centre, 2 gymnasia and a swimming pool. All pupils are given the chance to follow a 'balanced' curriculum and can be entered for 'O'and'A'level, CSE, and RSA examinations. School lunch is served in a cafeteria. Children are expected to wear the school uniform. Pupils are given the opportunity to prepare for a job with help from the careers department.
